page.title: 03MARTLESHAM HEATH AIRFIELD.
page.content: {The Aeroplane and Armament Experimental Establishment} as Martlesham Heath was now known,performed the exacting duties of testing all new British designed and constructed aircraft, engines, and ancillary equipment both military and civilian. In the military sphere, armaments of all types were experimented with and test dropped or fired over the marshland ranges of Martlesham's satellite testing station at nearby Orfordness. It was also not unusual for aircraft of foreign manufacture to be tested at the A.& A.E.E.much to the delight of between the wars aircraft spotters. Martlesham Heath's reputation as a centre of aircraft research became world famous and it's pilots listed as amongst the best in the profession,many becoming ousehold names.
